p.a: We are committed to keeping our learning community informed about COVID-19.

div.p: WelcomeTo Unionville-Sebewaing Area Schools: Our mission is to provide the support
necessary to meet the goals of students exiting our school district with the necessary
skills to be successful in an ever-changing global society.
We believe that all kids can learn.
We expect that students will master challenging academic material.
We are prepared to work together with students, parents and community.
We will achieve our shared purpose for USA students!
Search string may not be null or blank.

div.span: Accelerated Reading test can be taken @ home!
The accelerated reader program is available for testing for the HS/MS students from 7am-9pm daily, and the elementary students may take tests from 7am-8pm daily. Click here to take a test!
Follow Five Steps to Wash Your Hands the Right Way

Wet hands with clean, running water (warm or cold), turn off the tap, and apply soap. Lather hands by rubbing them together with the soap. Scrub hands for at least 20 seconds. Rinse hands well under clean, running water.
Keep up with district activities and events by following us on social media.
Family Educational Rights & Privacy Act of 1974

The USA School District Continuity of Learning and COVID-19 Response plan was formally implemented on April 13, 2020. The plan includes a description of our technology-based alternative to the traditional face-to-face model. The plan also includes methods to maintain connections with students and families, monitor learning, determine participation, etc.
Unionville-Sebewaing Area Schools Continuity of Learning Plan
Help for using Google School Online Learning Apps! We will be adding new resources daily to help students and parents/guardians navigate through their child's online learning lessons.

Skylert is the communication system for Unionville-Sebewaing Area Schools. The system is be used to let families know about emergency situations, weather-related delays/cancellations, low lunch account balances, student attendance, changes to scheduled events, and general school information. It is also used Information can be received through telephone/cell phone calls, e-mails and text messages. You have control over which notifications to receive and how you would like to receive them, through Skyward Parent Access. Once you have signed in to Skyward Parent Access, locate and click on the “Skylert” tab in the left hand column.
